question: I think my mother may have had a stroke.  She is a diabetic who lost her husband traumatically 3 months ago.  Since that time she has complained of significantly decreased vision (although she has limited vision due to diabetes), imbalance and we have noticed short term memory loss.  The cardiologist recommended that she see a neurologist who scheduled nerve conduction studies (she has diabetic neuropathy in her fingers and feet) and an MRI.  Why would she need nerve conduction studies at this stage (prior to any other tests?)
title: Why a nerve conduction study
